Class OutputHandler


  • public class OutputHandler

    This class is used to convert the BC's return values (ResultSet) into the client requested format. The following types are currently supported:

    • TXT
    • XML
    • HTML
    • JSON
    • XLSX
    See Also:
    []

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputHandler(BBjNumber debug)

      The default constructor used to create an instance of the OutputHandler. The debug value passed to this constructor indicates whether the RESTBridge is running in the debug mode or not.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and TypeMethod and Description
      StringcreateContent(String accept!)

      Creates the output based on the given accept header and returns it as String. The method return an empty String if the content is returned in a different way, for example per file download.

      Note: The method throws an !ERROR=406 if the accept header doesn't match any of the supported types.

      StringcreateDebug()

      Creates a

      StringcreateHTML()

      Creates the HTML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to text/HTML to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the HTML format.

      StringcreateJSON()

      Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/json to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.

      voidcreateOutput(String accept!)

      This method gets called by the RestBridge.bbj file and is responsible for creating the requested output. The method itself invokes the createContent(String) method and compressed the content returned from that method.

      Note: Do not overwrite this method in your custom output handler class, but rather overwrite the createContent(String) method. This method invokes the createContent(String) method and uses the content String returned from it.

      voidcreateTextXML()

      Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/JSON to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.

      voidcreateXLSX()

      Creates an Excel(.xlsx) file based on the ResultSet and offers the file for download. The methods sets the response's content type and its headers accordingly to inform the client about the file download.

      Note: This method doesn't return raw data in the response but rather provides a file download and therefore doesn't have a return value

      StringcreateXML()

      Creates the XML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/xml to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the XML format.

      voidsetCharset(String charset!)
      voidsetInvokeResult(HashMap invokeResult!)

      Sets the result of the BC invoke which contains infomation about the bc method invocation.

      voidsetRequest(BBxServletRequest request!)

      Set the BBxServletRequest object to use when handling the output.

      voidsetResponse(BBxServletResponse response!)

      Set the BBxServletResponse object to use when handling the output.

      voidsetResultSet(ResultSet rs!)

      Set the ResultSet to use when creating the output. The given ResultSet is usually the direct value from the BCs.

      • OutputHandler

        public OutputHandler(BBjNumber debug)

        The default constructor used to create an instance of the OutputHandler. The debug value passed to this constructor indicates whether the RESTBridge is running in the debug mode or not.

        Parameters:
        debug This value indicated wheter the RESTBridge is running in the debug mode or not.

    • Method Detail

      • createContent

        public String createContent(String accept!)

        Creates the output based on the given accept header and returns it as String. The method return an empty String if the content is returned in a different way, for example per file download.

        Note: The method throws an !ERROR=406 if the accept header doesn't match any of the supported types.

        Parameters:
        accept! The accept header sent by the client for the given request
        Returns:
        the content in the requested format or an empty string if the content was returned using a file download for instance.

      • createDebug

        public String createDebug()

        Creates a

        Returns:
        a string which contains usefull debug output

      • createHTML

        public String createHTML()

        Creates the HTML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to text/HTML to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the HTML format.

        Returns:
        the HMTL content to return to the client

      • createJSON

        public String createJSON()

        Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/json to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.

        Returns:
        the JSON content to return to the client

      • createOutput

        public void createOutput(String accept!)

        This method gets called by the RestBridge.bbj file and is responsible for creating the requested output. The method itself invokes the createContent(String) method and compressed the content returned from that method.

        Note: Do not overwrite this method in your custom output handler class, but rather overwrite the createContent(String) method. This method invokes the createContent(String) method and uses the content String returned from it.

        Parameters:
        accept! The accept header of the request

      • createTextXML

        public void createTextXML()

        Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/JSON to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.

        Returns:
        the JSON content to return to the client

      • createXLSX

        public void createXLSX()

        Creates an Excel(.xlsx) file based on the ResultSet and offers the file for download. The methods sets the response's content type and its headers accordingly to inform the client about the file download.

        Note: This method doesn't return raw data in the response but rather provides a file download and therefore doesn't have a return value

      • createXML

        public String createXML()

        Creates the XML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/xml to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the XML format.

        Returns:
        the XML-String content to return to the client
